From Wiktionary, the free dictionary

Catalan

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

From involucre.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): (Central) [im.bu.luˈkɾa]
  • IPA(key): (Balearic) [iɱ.vo.luˈkɾa]
  • IPA(key): (Valencia) [iɱ.vo.luˈkɾaɾ]
  • Audio (Barcelona):(file)
  • Rhymes: -a(ɾ)

Verb

[edit]

involucrar (first-person singular present involucro, first-person singular preterite involucrí, past participle involucrat)

  1. (transitive) to involve, meddle (with)
    Synonyms: embolicar, enredar

Conjugation

[edit]

Further reading

[edit]
  • “involucrar” in Diccionari català-valencià-balear, Antoni Maria Alcover and Francesc de Borja Moll, 1962.
  • “involucrar”, in Gran Diccionari de la Llengua Catalana, Grup Enciclopèdia Catalana, 2025
  • “involucrar”, in Diccionari de la llengua catalana [Dictionary of the Catalan Language] (in Catalan), second edition, Institute of Catalan Studies [Catalan: Institut d'Estudis Catalans], April 2007

Spanish

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

From involucro.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /imboluˈkɾaɾ/ [ĩm.bo.luˈkɾaɾ]
  • Rhymes: -aɾ
  • Syllabification: in‧vo‧lu‧crar

Verb

[edit]

involucrar (first-person singular present involucro, first-person singular preterite involucré, past participle involucrado)

  1. (transitive) to involve
  2. (reflexive) to meddle

Conjugation

[edit]

1Rare; now chiefly used in legal language.
2Argentine and Uruguayan voseo prefers the tuteo-form for the present subjunctive.
